text: so we have critical systems at
broadridge that can't afford to be down
we developed an always-on program using
AWS services to ensure that we were
having near zero recovery time
objectives and Recovery Point objectives
we built a multi-region solution with
traffic load balance across both regions
and we have health checks or Canary
lambdas built using services such as AWS
eventbridge AWS Lambda Amazon Route 53
application recovery controller all this
is built to have one region check the
health of another region and do
automatic failover if there's some kind
of a failure in maybe a database
endpoint or an application endpoint the
services and the multi-region
availability from AWS was a natural fit
to meet the resiliency that we were
looking for some of the testing that
we're doing we're seeing maybe 26 plus
percent of total time to recovery
Improvement and we're seeing about 60
data loss improvement over the the test
that we run we work very closely with
our AWS technical account team and we've
gone on Journeys with hackathons we've
done immersion days they've helped us
tremendously on this journey with this
resiliency solution that we've been
working on
[Music]
